intro: Cyrtandra semiorbicularis, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories on the islands of Hawaii. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
